Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: vlada37
Reviews.Content: We stayed here four nights in room 403. Room is same as picture on web site. View from the room is to the train station and it is noisy all the night. Hotel is very clean, staff very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was very poor, same every day but we could eat on every corner of Istanbul very quality food. Hotel location is excellent, in my opinion best location in Istanbul. Galata brigde, Haya Sophia, Sultanahmet area, Grand Bazar in walking distance maximum 10min. Overall, I would

Reviews.Title: “Eager to return!”
Reviews.Author: Voldomer
Reviews.Content: My family just returned from three nights at this hotel and had an excellent experience in every way. The staff was outstandingâ€”friendly, courteous, very attentive to any needs and questions, and very generous with candy for my daughter. The room (201) was spacious and very comfortable, with excellent beds and showers. Everything was very clean, well-maintained, and as presented in the photographs. Numerous options were available at breakfast, and my wife and daughter especially enjoyed the bread served at the tables. The location was ideal, a quick walk to the Archaeological Institute, Topkapi Palace, Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, etc., or to either of two tram stops on the T1 line. No problems with the hotel-arranged airport shuttle despite our flight arrival at 1 a.m.! I have stayed at two other hotels in Istanbul and numerous others elsewhere in Turkey at various price points, and this hotel is clearly my favorite for the overall experience.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: floydfloydfloyd
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two nights in room 201 and would definitely come back. The price was amazing and the room was spotless. The room is just as pictured on their website. We had a total of four people and were very comfortable. The staff was friendly and very helpful with directions of places to go and see. You can walk to many places such as the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, The Grand Bazaar and The Egyptian (Spice) Market. Breakfast was also included as well as free wireless. Another plus is that the tram stop is right around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Ausra Z
Reviews.Content: We have spent 4 wonderful nights in this cozy hotel. Most of all, we enjoyed very friendly and utmost helpful staff of the hotel. Every member of staff showed their proficiency in providing any advice and demonstrated deep knowledge about any issue. Our room was very comfortable, large and very well preserved. The room contained the set for tea, coffee, minibar and safe box. The hotel was very comfortably located, not far from tram station, easy to reach to any historic sites, such as Sultanahmet, Bosphorus. Big choice of food during breakfast, very pleasant service. Actually, this created the great atmosphere as being at home. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Well located”
Reviews.Author: Tea987
Reviews.Content: Very nice Hotel very helpfull stuff and well located.

Reviews.Title: “Small, friendly, personal hotel extremely convenient to major tourist sites and to various public transport”
Reviews.Author: Chelydra
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the hotel and would recommend it; however, with a caveat (mentioned at the end) which might not bother other people. Getting to the hotel, we suggest that you use the hotel shuttle service. We checked the practicality of using the metro and then transferring to the T1 tram. The problem lies in getting from Aksary metro station to Yusufpasa tram stop. You will have a long, inconvenient walk which will include going down and then up the steps of a highway underpass, another walk, and then up and down the stairs of the overpass leading to the platform of the tram stop. Also, it will require your buying from an automatic vending machine two separate tokens at 1.75 TL each (note that different modes of transport can use different types of token, for instance, metal rather than plastic). In Istanbul changing from one mode of transport to another usually requires your having to buy a new token. To get to the airport from the hotel, you can find local shuttle services in the vicinity of the hotel for as low as 5 TL. The hotel can also arrange for your pick up. Note that if you will visit Istanbul for an extended period and use public transport extensively, consider buying an "Akbil" travel pass (a small metal disk on a plastic handle with multiple trips encoded which you can conveniently recharge at vending machines). The Akbil (which you touch at a point in front of entry turnstiles) makes it convenient to use all types of public transport, gives you a small discount on the fare, and makes transfers both easier and cheaper. Remember to collect the refund on your Akbil deposit before you leave the city. All the staff we encountered at the hotel were exceptionally welcoming, friendly, cooperative and hospitable. The service that they rendered to us would have done credit to a five star hotel. In particular, Vesyl at reception was extremely amiable, charming and helpful; Baris was very pleasant and efficient (having replied promptly and fully to all our e-mails arranging a reservation and pick-up at the airport). Vele and Ibrahim were attentive to the needs of guests at breakfast and at other times during their shifts, for instance serving us tea and coffee when we returned exhausted from an active day of sightseeing. Every day Ilke and Nebibe consistently and reliably made up our room, and replaced toiletries and bottled water that we had used. For our purposes of exploring as much as possible of Istanbul and surrounding areas on foot and by public transport, the location of the hotel on Nobethane Caddesi in Sirkeci was superb. Nobethane Caddesi is a small street, recently completely repaved, one block away from the main street, Hudavendigar Caddesi, along which the T1 tram passes and will take you to major tourist sites. If you would like a base convenient to historic sites, restaurants, shops, and to tram, train, bus and ferry services, you could hardly find a more central point for starting your day of sightseeing. For those of us who enjoy walking as a way of absorbing the atmosphere of a city, the following details provide a rough estimate of walking-strolling times from the hotel to places of major interest: local restaurants 1-10 minutes; T1 tram stop "Gulhane" (closer, more convenient and 3-4 mins. to the hotel) or "Sirkeci" 4-6 mins. (in both directions which it travels, the convenient, modern trams will take you to most major tourist sights or to a stop only a short walk away); Sirkeci train station and the tourist office outside (10 a.m. to 6 p.m.) 5-7 mins.; ferry terminals 10-15 mins.; Yeni (New) Mosque (fabulous tiled interior and my favorite mosque) and Egyptian (Spice) Bazaar 12-17 mins.; bus terminal at and Galata Bridge 15-20 mins.; Gulhane Parki, Archeological Museum, Topkapi Palace 15-20 mins.; Hagia Sofia (breathtaking interior; better visited at the end of the day when most of the tour groups have gone and afternoon light floods the interior; note that the guards start shepherding visitors to leave more than an hour before "official" closing at 7 p.m. and try to have everyone out by 6:30 p.m. at the latest), Blue Mosque, and Turkish and Islamic Arts Museum, Binbirdirek Cistern 20-25 mins.; Grand Bazaar 25-30 mins. The rooms we used were suitably appointed and of adequate size to move around and to open a suitcase on the parquet floor. The bathroom had a shower stall of reasonable size; it did not have a bathtub or bidet. The hot water system worked well, except for one morning; staff had the service fixed promptly and apologized for the interruption. We found the bed and the pillows (two per person but you can ask for more) comfortable. The air conditioning worked well. We had the hotel remove the beverages (for purchase) that they provided in the small bar fridge so that we could use the space for items that we bought at a small, convenience supermarket (which had a limited selection of basic items) a few minutes walk away on Hudavendigar Caddesi (the main street one block away). The coffee and tea making facilities in the room included a selection of ordinary and herbal teas. The free WiFi connection worked flawlessly during our stay. (Opposite the reception counter in the entrance were a desktop and a laptop computer for the use of guests who did not bring their own computer.) Smoking was not a problem as most guests did not smoke and the staff smoked outside the hotel. If a previous guest had smoked in your room, you could air it out quite easily by fully opening the French doors at your convenience. The flat screen TV satellite service provided scores of international channels in numerous languages. There were two remote controls. The red button at the top of the larger one marked "Vestel" turned the display on and off and controlled the volume. The smaller one marked "botech" turned the satellite TV service on and off, and controlled the selection of channels and, to some degree, also the volume. On the smaller remote control, pressing OK displayed a list of 10 channels, the left arrow showed the next 10 down and the right arrow the next 10 up, the up arrow selected the next individual channel above, the down arrow the next channel below, and pressing OK made the list disappear and displayed the channel highlighted. At the back of the ground floor was the breakfast room (buffet breakfast available 7:30 a.m. to 10:30 a.m.). The choice did not vary during our stay; however, the selection was sufficiently broad that we could concentrate on different combinations on different mornings according to how we felt. The choice included: tea, coffee, milk, orange and pomegranate juices, three cereals (four on our last day), bread (you could toast), bread rolls, butter, several jams, honey, cream cheese, hazelnut-chocolate spread, three types of cheese, two types of sausage, raisins, dried apricots and figs, two types of cake slices, sweet biscuits, pastry roll slices, sliced fresh tomato, sliced fresh cucumber, hard-boiled eggs, plain yogurt, black and green olives, oranges and apples. The hotel had a personal feel because of its small size (we counted 16 rooms distributed over seven floors) and the warmth of the staff. Room 101 on the ground floor opened directly into the back of the breakfast room. The second, third and fourth floors had three rooms each: one in the front facing Nobethane Caddesi, one in the middle facing the back and one in the far back at the end of a corridor. The fifth, sixth and seventh floors had two rooms each: one in the front facing the street and one in the back. The front room we had first was reasonably spacious, and furnished with both a king and a twin bed, and a sofa plus a desk, stool (I suggest replacing stools with chairs which have a back), easy chairs, bedside tables (the addition of table lamps for reading at night and stronger room lights would brighten rooms), etc. The lift-elevator (small and suitable for two people, three at most) and stairs were just outside the door. In the room, triple-glazed French doors when closed admitted only minor street noise such as occasional car horns and persons shouting (the narrow street is not a main thoroughfare so carries only limited traffic). These sounds should be less of an issue the higher up your room. During our stay, workers were digging up, excavating, laying pipes and re-laying the street, even at night, (the work would be well finished by the time you read this review) so we moved to a back room. The staff were extremely obliging in this transfer. Vesyl recommended that we wait for room 403, which had no other room above, and it worked out quite well. The back rooms look over Sirkeci train station (the destination of the Orient Express and featured in an Agatha Christie mystery â€” have a look in the station restaurant) toward Galata and its tower in the distance. You might also be able to glimpse the water of the Golden Horn and passing ferries. Room 403 has a small terrace with a round cafe table and two chairs. Room 502 has a large terrace with patio furniture. Rooms 602 and 702 have small fire escape balconies. The x02 rooms are set back so do not have as much of a view because to the right is the side wall and back of another, large hotel. The doors of the rooms on the seventh floor face the lift-elevator machinery; also, one has to walk up the stairs from the sixth floor to reach the rooms. In our back room, which had a king size bed, the triple-glazed French doors blocked the entry of outside noise quite effectively. There is some construction at the side of Sirkeci station for a tunnel which will connect the European and Asian shores; however, with the French door closed we did not hear anything from the work which might have been going on. Around the hotel there are lots of restaurants at various prices and quality. The one next to the hotel entrance actually belongs to the hotel. We did not eat there because we thought the prices a bit high for the dishes listed on the menu. If no one offers you a discount, ask for one before eating there. Two (parallel) streets up from the hotel, pedestrian Ibni Kemal Caddesi is lined with restaurants. Opposite the front of Sirkeci train station are a McDonalds and a Burger King, if you feel like conventional western fast food. The pedestrian walk under Galata Bridge itself is lined on both sides with fish restaurants and bars and in Galata itself there are numerous restaurants along the many side lanes of Istiklal Caddesi â€” the main, pedestrian shopping street and center of night life (accessible on foot from the hotel, about 20-30 mins., but uphill once you have crossed Galata Bridge). We found the lack of internal soundproofing insufficient to prevent a night's sleep (as the hotel was quiet when everyone had settled in), but enough to prevent an uninterrupted night's sleep because of different guests leaving and returning to their rooms at different times (which normally happens in a hotel). If you sleep soundly, the following details should not affect you; however, some of us are a bit sensitive to extraneous noises. The room doors and their frames are not soundproofed (wood-against-wood with nothing in between). This means that sounds from the corridor and stairwell can enter the room. In fact, attractive as the doors might be (suitable perhaps for private apartments), they do not seem suitable for hotel rooms. Some sounds which can come into the room: people commonly slamming their room door, even on other floors (which we knew of from our initial enquiries, but did not know the extent of); attempts to fit a key into, and the opening and closing of room door locks (conventional metal key and spring-loaded metal tongue lock); people's shoes as they clip-clop up or down the stone stairs â€” partially screened by panels of sheetrock but otherwise open and connected between floors; water flowing when someone in a center x02 room takes a shower (the ventilation port opens into the corridor), conversation if people linger in the corridor (for instance, waiting for the lift-elevator or saying goodnight to others), cleaners preparing rooms, any other noise of activity outside the room. The owners could cheaply and easily alleviate this deficiency. On the door of each room, they could install heavy-duty, institutional-grade door closers (the mechanisms which automatically and gradually close a door so that it cannot be slammed) and ensure that they are properly adjusted for rates of closing and latching. They could also install a seal around the entire frame and the threshold or around the entire door so that it acoustically isolates the room from the corridor. Were it not for the lack of internal soundproofing, I might have given this type of hotel my first rating of Excellent from all the modest hotels around the world which my partner and I have stayed at; hence, given the superb staff, exceptional service and outstanding location, I will leave it at Very Good. A last note about the back of the hotel. Just to the side there is a yellow, emergency electric power generator about the size of half a cargo container. It belongs to another building. If there is a power failure (which occurred during the street works when an excavator cut the electricity cable to the area), it will start automatically. When it operates, it sounds like a mechanical jackhammer. You can hardly hear it at the front of the hotel, but will hardly avoid hearing it in the back should it start. A power failure should be an exceptional and rare event, so for greater quiet I would still prefer a room at the far back of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “NÄ±ce hotel good people”
Reviews.Author: itsme8976
Reviews.Content: Stayed at GALATA ISTANBUL HOTEL for 2 weeks and enjoyed every moment. Right in the center of the city/ A short hop on the metro at the airport and a transfer to the tram will take you to center city and within 8 to 10 walking minutes to the hotel, Baris, Veysel and VelÄ± wÄ±ll make your stay pleasent and enjoyable. Rooms are not large but very clean and confortable, new TV, modern decoration, free Istanbul breakfast, WiFi and free use of hotel laptop will make your stap inmemorable.

Reviews.Title: “Had a wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: May002
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights and the service was excelent. Had a very warm welcome from management and staff. Also acomodation was excelent we were actually upgraded to a suite and had space for a whole family and we were only two. The cleanliness and comfort o th hotel was also of a high calibre. Near to the train and tram lines so it is easy to get around. Also a short walk away from the ferry station, the spice bazaar and the New Mosque. Many shops and restaurants in the viscinity as well. If you came to see the sights of Istanbul it is a very good location.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Galata has a very pleasant staff.”
Reviews.Author: Sav1932
Reviews.Content: People's service at the hotel is excellent. My room for 3 was on the 4th floor. It was quite comfortable except the bathroom was quite small but manageable. The neighborhood is nice except that there was heavy construction work on the street. It will be a very welcoming neighborhood after the street work is completed. Hotel is within walking distance of all the sites we wanted to visit. I don't think there are great room views at this hotel but we did not care about that. Breakfast is just okay.

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE”
Reviews.Author: TITOsudbury
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Hotel to celebrate my 65th birthday. I agree with some of the comments by readers about the situation of the Hotel and the helpful staff. But we moved out on the second night, because the hotel is so small our rooms were situated in both sides of the elevator, making it very noisy, The hotel seems to me that it wasn't finish as the plaster boards appeared to be broken and unfinished. The curtains in the rooms were shortconsequently it didn't cover the windows hence allowing light through in the early hours. The rooms were clean,perhaps in stead of supplying bath robes to guest ( I didn't expect this on this hotel ) the management spent this money in finishing the hotel proper, as for the dining room...... Unfortunately the road had been dug up NO the hotels fault, and the noise of massive diggers working till 10.30 PM. We tried in our first day the restaurant next door, never again.

Reviews.Title: “More than your money's worth”
Reviews.Author: itchyfeetBangkok
Reviews.Content: I couldn't ask for more in a hotel. It may not be luxurious but the people (Baris, Veyser and the owners) and staff went their way out to make our stay meaningful. They helped and advised us on our tours, booked tickets, etc. They were really so nice and always with a cup of apple tea and smiling. The hotel itself is not big but very comfortable, there is wifi and computer access, the breakfast was good and healthy, there is also an elevator (tiny) and there is a restaurant beside the hotel owned by the same family. The rooms are not that big but comfortable in size with coffee and tea, heating and air conditioning.There is an al fresco lounge infront where you can people watch or have a water pipe or a drink. Places of interest are all within walking distance. You can take the tram at Sircesi if you do not want to walk. I would definitely recommend this hotel especially for a good and clean holiday. I will surely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in quiet street”
Reviews.Author: tariwa
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a small and quiet street just near the trainstation Sirkeci. Also the next tramstop is only a few steps away. The hotel is small, but clean and inviting. The staircase is very steep, but is also has an elevator. Our 3-bed-room was quite spacious, only the bathroom ist very small. Everything was clean. The personal is very friendly and helpful and speak quite good English.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: josebtesh
Reviews.Content: ThÄ±s Ä±s a great Hotel Ä±n a great locatÄ±on. ServÄ±ce Ä±s fantastÄ±c, hotel Ä±s located Ä±n a safe locatÄ±on, near all sÄ±ghtseeÄ±ng monuments. Breakfast Ä±s good, matress Ä±s perfect and shower pressure amazÄ±ng. I recommend anyone to stay thÄ±s place. BarÄ±s, the manager, takes care of every need you may have, makÄ±ng servÄ±ce admÄ±rable.

Reviews.Title: “superrr”
Reviews.Author: Rasakal
Reviews.Content: i loved this hotel its really porfect i ofer for all of peaple to vist at this hotel when they want to go istanbul its centrum a in old city very close everywhere hagyasofiya bluemosqe garand bazar spisa bazar taksim room was very cleen stuf was halpfull quait room breakfeast was nice to thanks galataistanbulhotel

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: xenberry
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very clean and in a walking distance to old town, also tram station is very close.Rooms are very very very clean and well equiped.They gave us complimentary tea and coffee.Rooms cleaned daily.Staff was friendly and breakfast was good.We are satisfied and definitelly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “SHOCKING!”
Reviews.Author: katarina5358
Reviews.Content: Galata hotel has been closed in day of our arrival. We haven't received any message from hotel about this fact. When we have arrived to hotel at late night, to us have offered placing in other hotel. This hotel was awful! We couldn't remain there minutes. At late night we have been compelled to search for other hotel independently. Hotel Galata staff operated simply nonprofessionally and shockingly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel recommend to anyone, location great and rooms clean and renovated!”
Reviews.Author: AJWILSON1975
Reviews.Content: My first time to Istanbul so I did a lot of searching for a nice hotel with good location, clean rooms and a good price and thats what I got! Staff very helpful including a Jackie Chan lookalike porter was funny dressed in his tuxedo. Location easy walking distance to Blue Mosque, Sophia and Grand Bazzar. A stroll across the water is Galata Tower for awesome views to all Istanbul a must see. Only changes I would make some improvements on the breakfast was a bit simple for a turkish hotel, but on my girlfriends request for a toasted cheese and salami sandwich they sent out for takeaway at no extra charge! very accomodating! other than that our room was very clean, tidy, renovated with enough room some people on tripadvisor had said the rooms were a bit small but compared to some of our other travels this was more than enough. I always look for a good shower too and it was awesome! Nice quiet room at the back of the hotel also. Keep it up Galata thanks for making our trip to Istanbul very memorable! Andre London UK

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel at a great location”
Reviews.Author: BelNica
Reviews.Content: Would definitely recommend this hotel! All the main tourist attractions (Hagia Sophia, Blue mosque etc.) are just around the corner and Taksim (the popular,modern area where all the shops/bars/clubs are) is also at walking distance. The staff is supersuperfriendly and everything was very clean. Beds are comfortable and there's wireless internet, tv, airconditioning, a hairdryer (Whoohooo), bathrobe/flipflops/shampoo...everything included in the price. Furthermore, the rooms get cleaned (and the towels get changed) every day. It's not a top-luxury hotel but really good value for your money!! Couldn't be more satisfied with this hotel :)

Reviews.Title: “The nicest and most helpful staff I've ever encountered in a hotel”
Reviews.Author: niner08
Reviews.Content: From the moment I was picked up at the airport, the staff ot he hotel was helpful and friendly. As this is a budget hotel, this isn't courtesy that is bought; the people working here are actually nice and want you to enjoy your stay at the hotel and in Istanbul. My room was small but clean and in good repair. The daily breakffast buffet was plentiful. The high speed internet worked during my entire stay and there are computers in the lobby in case you don't want to bring one from home. The location might seem less than perfect as it is in neither the old historic center or the new town around Taksim. However, both are close and easily accessible by public transport or taxi (Sultanahmet is particularly easy to get to from the hotel). This is not the hotel for a person who demands luxury or for someone unwilling to do a little work to access the top sites. It IS for people who want to pay a fair price and be treated well.

Reviews.Title: “EXcellent!!! Purely perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Kasienka1974
Reviews.Content: After a very unpleasant experience in a different hotel - here comes a surprise! Situated just minutes from the main attractions of Istanbul, very clean, comfortable and reasonably cheap hotel. Excellent customer service, staff extremely helpful and flexible! Room was the biggest surprise as it was equipped in everything needed, air conditioning/heating, TV, brand new furniture, clean and cosy, however quite big! The bathroom newly refurbished, power shower, I wish my own looked like this! Superb experience! Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Service, location, price, and Service were great”
Reviews.Author: chrisandamyviajeros
Reviews.Content: We stayed three days, traveled, and came back for two more days. The staff and Baris in paticular were extremely helpful in making arrangements or providing sources and additional amenities to make our visit fun and smooth. The location was in easy walking distance of many primary tourist attractions, markets, bridges or tansportation to other parts of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money in perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: Lisa80
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a weekend mid October. Pre-arrival Baris had been extremely helpful with information and speedy communication. A good first impression! On arrival we were shown to our terrace room on the 5th floor which had french doors opening onto a large terrace. Admittedly, the terrace was in amongst the back of various buildings and was a bit noisy but you could see the river and the Galata tower. The terrace could really be very beautiful if they put some plants out there. I think the hotel has been recently refurbished and the room itself was modern and very clean and the en-suite was small but modern. Breakfast was good and varied but room 102 seemed to open onto the breakfast area - this mihgt bother some who get woken easily... We asked for dinner recommendations and were taken persnally by one of the guys to a restaurant they recommended. We also booked dinner at 360 (Definitely recommended) and the hotel reserved for us and arranged a taxi. It was easily walkable though and we came back on foot over the Galata bridge. All in all I would definitely recommend this hotel for the friendly staff, cleanliness and great location. The location of the hotel is excellent with the Blue Mosque, bazaars, Hagia Sophia only a few minutes walk away!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: Diane255060
Reviews.Content: Clean comfortable room, great breakfast, helpful & friendly staff. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to say”
Reviews.Author: dish_lex
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great find. The room was large, well equipped, clean and modern. The staff were friendly and it is also in a great location. The price was very reasonable for what we got and the breakfast was great. Overall a great place to say! There are only two things that I will mention, just in case it is important for anyone. The lift is small, we could only fit one of us in at a time with our luggage, but without our luggage it was fine. Also, if you get any laundry done, they give it to people up the road to do and they charge a lot. They charge on weight so make sure you only put in what you really want/need washed. We learnt the hard way, so I would suggest that you ask the total price before you agree to go ahead, and make sure you say you don't want things ironed if you don't want to pay extra.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: turizim
Reviews.Content: we love this hotel, perfect location, everything is wonderful so kind and so nice staff highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “excellent staff, comfortable, clean new accomodation, close to historic sights, complimentary tea throughout the day.”
Reviews.Author: amera1234
Reviews.Content: very welcoming and flexible staff, great service, complimentary breakfast. We enjoyed our stay. location was great.We loved the complimentary tea / cofee throughout the day. Very relaxing environment.

HotelInfo.Name: Galata Istanbul Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Hocapasa Mah. Nobethane Cad. No : 24 Sultanahmet | Sirkeci / Fatih, Istanbul 34110, Turkey
